alert.note: Alert for Gila; Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 5:30PM MST until July 30 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MST FOR GILA...MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 530 PM MST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Four Peaks to near Queen Valley, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Sugarloaf Mountain, Queen Creek, Granite Reef Dam, Gold Camp, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Usery Mountain Park, San Tan Valley, Florence Junction, Saguaro Lake, Queen Valley, and Canyon Lake. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 190 and 216. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 190 and 210. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 23 and 34. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
